This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africans. The transformed feelings one feels from watching this film are in line with the transformation that South Africans go through when they come to another continent with more troubles than we could ever fathom.
Nonetheless, this made for a terrific film with amazing cinematography and beautiful acting by director Jennifer Geach and brother Rond

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may criticise that people in the movie behaved like animals because all of them couldn't keep their hands off each other and they perpetually went after women like crazy dogs but to me those characters were as much human as a dog or elephant is.
